comments.commentBody:
SZYY,

You think maybe a Farmer-Democratic-Labor Party might explain part of it?

In Wisconsin, you have people sensible enough to see that agricultural supports are the work of government. Elsewhere, you have people who are dependent on what Ezra Taft Benson accurately called "socialism," but who seem to think the transfer payments come from their god.

Government? That's the problem, not the source of their cheques. You gotta believe it. Everybody in the whole church agrees.

-dlj.
He knows he's going to lose, so to save face he is trying to delegitimatize the process.And conservatives have been suppressing minority vote since before the founding.
I sure hope that you are right.

No one disputes that it is important to be vigilant about irregularities, but for the GOP candidate to say, absent any evidence, that the election is "rigged" would be irresponsible to start with.  When you step back and consider that Trump's whole campaign is rooted in bigotry, anger, aggression, and tacit approval of violence, it becomes downright dangerous.  I'm no liberal, but you'd have to be a fool to think that Trump is merely calling for responsible monitoring of the polls.  This man's credibility is zero.  He has tried every sleazy measure he can think of to save him from what is shaping up to be a very embarrassing loss on November 8th.  I know people's partisan feelings shade their perception of things, and I am no fan of Hillary myself, but there is a point at which you need to set the politicking aside and recognize someone for what he is.  Donald Trump is an egomaniacal monster who would burn this country to the ground if it will spare him the humiliation coming toward him in three weeks.  Enough with the GOP posturing.  We all need to just come together and admit this whole election has been a black mark and move on.  I for one hope the GOP refocuses and brings back a candidate the caliber of Romney or McCain next time.  But this cause is lost.  The only thing left to do is be responsible and patriotic, and denounce this cretin and his unfounded cries of fraud along with him, or I fear there is a very good chance something very bad will happen on Election Day.
Are we becoming a banana republic? I cannot believe that Trump continues to spew this garbage and that his followers are taking him seriously.
I've decided that I'm bringing my camera and will consider it my job to watch the watchers, intervene to stop any intimidation, and report any craziness by these people.

It would seem that the cowardice of Paul Ryan and Mitch McConnell knows no bounds. Here they have a chance for some honor and a small amount of redemption but no, they can only wring their hands as Trump goose-steps on their heads and orchestrates his nightmare on democracy.
Clerks are empowered to prevent anomalies. What Trump is calling for is nothing short of vigilantism.
Trump is a modern day Westbrook Pegler. Pegler attacked Eleanor Roosevelt aka Hillary Clinton.
Why are you so sure? Please, take a moment and consider: if it were Hillary saying the same thing, would you be so blasé about it? Come on.

My real fear is that, increasingly, I reed about more and more of his "supporters" saying things like ... he is right that, when Hillary wins, we will shortly be a one-party country.

And they actually believe that while it may not be on November 10, they are considering getting their militias together.

Second Amendment rights and all that.
The more he screeches 'rigged' & 'fixed' the more he anticipates the severity of the loss.

Great suggestions! Which are all in effect in North Carolina, which offers more available voting than almost any state. In NY, you can only vote on one day. In NC, they've been allowed to vote for a few weeks already.

Except government issued IDs cost money (and there's no reason to have a driver's license if you don't have a car and never drive -- which is many innercity people). Voting is a right of citizenship (unlike getting on a plane) and should not harder to do if you're poor than if you're not. If all the IDs were issued to everyone at age 18, automatically and free of cost, like they do in some countries, this would be a different question.
I wish that president Obama would hold a prime time special broadcast addressing these issues. Discussing how voter fraud fails to exist and also Trump's allegation causing voter intimidation.

taopraxis - Maybe you are right, but what if you are wrong, and frankly in this case I think you are wrong by more than just a little bit? All of us have to do the best we can or the system fails, and if you can tell the difference between the two candidates, and you still choose sit on your butt, than you are part of the problem.
The format of the ballot was considers to be the big problem i n Florida. Those ballots were counted and re-counted several times. A cell phone video would not have made a difference.

What a difference 16 years makes. With smartphones now ubiquitous, I just don't think stuff like roadblocks being set up in black neighborhoods to make it more difficult to vote on Election Day--as supposedly happened in Florida in 2000 under Jeb Bush's governorship--will occur without hundreds of people recording the whole deplorable activities for all to see. It's amazing to think of how primitive cell phone technology was at the tail end of Bill Clinton's presidency.

Let's also be very clear that the enormous amount of energy added into the system is not caused by inert gases such as water vapor, carbon dioxide, methane or nitrous oxide.  The energy is external and the gases, the greenhouse gases, react just as the ingredients in a cake react when an oven is turned on.

Maybe that was the point Susan, to focus on Cliff that is, maybe it was an article not about the weather but about a climate scientist?  Further to accuse Professor Mass of a bias with rhetoric towards the industry and science is telling.  Al Gore once predicted the end of the world.  Professor Mass actually knows the science better than Al Gore.  He actually works in the field.  Please stop feeding the media.

NorthXNW, I am not "feeding the media". Cliff Mass is "feeding the media". Not in this case, but in cases where the attribution is complex. You make your position clear, and demonstrate exactly why I, with my limited skills, needed to weigh in here about the hero worship and Mr. Behar's failure to seek other sources.

It is troubling that this article focuses so heavily on Cliff Mass. He is known for pushing against the increasing evidence of the influence of global warming/climate change in weather trends.

He is a top meteorologist making valuable points, as presented here. But his bias against accepting the connection, while not exactly climate science denial, overstates the lack of connection.

To repeat: overstates the lack of connection. The problem is, there appears to be a mental block to increasing evidence in weather over time. It's hard enough for your average Joe or Jane to figure out what is real and what is not without the delicate thumb on the scale.

I wish the author had consulted with some other scientists. His justifiable affection and respect for the dynamic Cliff Mass needs some context.

It's not quite the same thing, but people blaming Obama for the defunding of science and equipment at NOAA are making a similar mistake. Except for 5 months in 2009, all budgetary efforts have been subjected to an increasingly unified opposition, one that allows no deviation from the religion of climate science denial, which is not skeptical at all.

Our weather people are well aware of the European model. The new GOES satellite should help, but Matthew in Florida likely did some harm to Cape Canaveral which may result in launch delay.

Here's an excellent statistical review of one of his efforts:
https://tamino.wordpress.com/2015/08/19/cliff-mass-picking-cherries-in-f...
You must be talking about Obama, who is definitely anti-American. Look at what he's done and will do if Hillary is elected.

@Alan
Aloha bruddah!
You just need to Google “guns polling sites (state)”

Hawai’i has the fewest gun registrations of ALL states---THREE conceal carry permits--and only 5% even have a gun permit. In 67 years I knew NO ONE who owned a gun. With a population of 1.3 million--with one million on Oahu, the city and county of Honolulu.

Stay in Hawai’i--it’s NUTS on the Mainland!
It is the Democrats rioting and causing violence at Trump rallies, not the other way around.

What is the gun-carry law in Pennsylvania and Ohio in the context of polling sites? Considering the rabidness of some of Trump’s supporters, and his previous call to “Second Amendment people,” it seems like a relevant consideration. And why is he trying to drag America’s democratic process into the sewer? His statements go far beyond being psychologically incapable of admitting he’s a loser. It’s like he despises our nation and its ideals.

I cannot imagine waking up each day for the next four years and having to adjust my life, and the precautions I take, based on his latest whim or grudge. He must be soundly rejected, so a presidential candidate like him never appears again.

I so much agree on this. I live in California and have been a permanent absentee vote-by-mail voter for years. It's great. This year's November ballot contains a huge number of propositions to vote on. With a mail-in ballot I can sit down, study each proposition online and make a decision without being in a hurry and with full access to information, so my vote is an informed one. I think it's a better way to vote and wish the entire country would switch over to vote-by-mail. Plus, there's a paper trail. And no code that can be hacked, at least not at the individual, polling-station level - I suppose county databases could be hacked, but you'd still have the mailed-in paper ballots as backup once a hack was detected.

Too bad most states don't vote like Oregon and Washington. There are no polling stations here. Everyone votes by mail, filling out their ballots in the comfort of their home, and mailing them in or dropping them off at collection stations at a time that is most convenient to them. Trump's minions can't intimidate any voters in Oregon and Washington. There are no voting machines to worry about. No one needs to take time off work to get to a polling station. Best of all, there are no exit polls because there are no polls.
Well he does have a point, lots of Republicans do hate him.

My concern:
This chorus of Republicans piously proclaiming the inviolate rules assuring an honest election may be a form of "preventive inoculation".
While Trump distracts us with his loud insinuations of widespread voter fraud , the Republican will actually rig the election with all manner of voter suppression rules already in place.
If these efforts somehow give the election to Trump, they will, with assistance from clueless Democrats, again remind us of the integrity of this election. Already persuaded by their pre-election assurances, we will all, glumly but obediently, accept the results.
Tell me I'm paranoid, please.

If the Clinton campaign were rigging the election, as Donald Trump claims, one would expect some evidence of that plan to have surfaced in the trove of hacked emails being released by WikiLeaks.  Instead, the only evidence of tampering with the electoral process is Russian fingerprints on the hacking in an apparent effort to prevent Hillary Clinton from becoming president.  Once again Trump is given a leg up, and he can only complain about being treated unfairly.
Gold.  Your comment should be front page headline.

This is Donny's hedge against the massive, humiliating defeat we'll all be watching him suffer on the 8th of November. Rather than reflecting on and absorbing the facts, he'll be spewing more of his empty "hey, look over there" diversions.
Voting from the comfort of your own home. What's not to love? Get your mail-in-ballot now and forget all this chicanery.

Everyone, to whatever extent these threats materialize, it's more likely to be on election day than before it. So especially if you are a minority or live in an area with a high population of minorities, GO VOTE EARLY. Oregon votes by mail. Maybe we should do that.
